Purley-FPGA Server SKX/LBG B-Stepping Gold Release Announcement

\n \n

[ Intel Use Only \xe2\x80\x93 Intel Confidential ]

2016 WW53 Purley-FPGA Server SKX/LBG B-Stepping Gold Release Announcement (BKC #11)

\n \n \n

DEG Platform Integration Team

\n \n
\n

The DEG platform Integration team announces the release of 2016 WW53 Purley-FPGA Server SKX/LBG B-Stepping Gold release package for Intel internal use. The release is based on OS of\n \n Linux\n server. The auto-installer packages are available in the Artifactory server (both SH site and OR site). Any questions please contact Bei, Ling.

\n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n
Auto InstallerSH Artifactory ServerOR Artifactory Server
LinuxWithoutOS_BKC-FPGA_RHEL7.2_24.109323.109322-2016WW53.zip\n \n
RHEL7.3Serverx86_64.zip\n 		WithoutOS_BKC-FPGA_RHEL7.2_24.109323.109322-2016WW53.zip\n \n
RHEL7.3Serverx86_64.zip\n
\n

*Note: Please select the server which is closer to your region to get the better data accessing/downloading performance

Test Result:

\xc2\xb7      \nFinish Gold test execution\non RHEL 7.3. Please visit HPQC for test details. Refer to the installation guide for\nthe BKC package installation

\n\n\n\n

    \xc2\xb7      \nPurley FPGA (RP Board: Neon City FPGA)

o  \nTotal test cases: 29; Passed test\ncases is 24 and pass rate is 82.76%. 

o  \nTest coverage:  

\xc2\xa7    \nSKX-FPGA B0 VIS/LBG B1: Run full BKC test case, P&P and Power cycling test.



\n\n

Sighting Update:

\n\n

\n
\n   HW Rework \n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n \n \n \n \n
\n

Key Workaround (detail guide is here)

\n\n

\xc2\xb7        \nPlease\nuse PCIe Video card instead of onboard BMC video due to known BMC issue

\n\n

 

Pedigree and Board\nJumper Settings: guide

\n\n\n\n

Note: Only mandatory and necessary optional rework is implemented\nby BKC team

\n\n

Mandatory rework FPGA JTAG chain missing\nCPU1 TCK resistor

\n\n

 Mandatory rework\nto replace FPGA KR RX AC Caps

\n\n

Mandatory\nrework add a pull down to RSMRST

\n\n

Mandatory\nrework to update VR FW

\n\n

CPLD\nupdates to address IFWI issue with 2 SKX FPGA CPUs populated

\n\nRequired\nCPLD updates to address reset and FSC issues

\n \n

Notes: To subscribe or unsubscribe to this mailing list please click here.

InformationQuick Guide
BKC One Stop Shop

Link: https://dcg-oss.intel.com

Steps for applying the permission:

  • Go to EAM website: http://eam.intel.com/EAMWeb/default.aspx
  • Click on "Add or Remove access"
  • Navigate to:"Enterprise Applications - CI Automation \xe2\x80\x93 One Stop Shop (OSS) \xe2\x80\x93 BKC \xe2\x80\x93 Purley"
  • Apply for the "User" or "Ingredient Owner" role
  • Use your windows credentials for authentication

Contact Person: Bei, Ling

BKC Artifactory Access

Link (SH server): https://ubit-artifactory-sh.intel.com

Link (OR server): https://ubit-artifactory-or.intel.com

Steps for applying the permission:

  • Go to EAM website:http://eam.intel.com/EAMWeb/default.aspx
  • Click on "Add or Remove access"
  • Navigate to:"Enterprise Applications - DevTools - DEG_Purley"
  • Apply for the "Project viewer" role
  • Use your windows credentials for authentication
